content.webTitle: Film review: Jimmy Carter: Man From Plains

fields.headline: Jimmy Carter: Man From Plains
fields.bodyText: Jonathan Demme had free daily access to the 39th US President while following him around during the publicity tour for his controversial 2006 book Palestine: Peace Not Apartheid . The resulting first-rate documentary, Jimmy Carter: Man From Plains, is a fascinating portrait of a man of true probity; articulate, honest, modest, intelligent and often very funny. The hostility he runs into from some Jewish audiences (most notably in Phoenix where he was the target of crude demonstrations and of abusive rabbis who refused to go on the record) is truly disturbing.
